org.assertj.swing.driver

Class JScrollBarLocation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.assertj.swing.driver.JScrollBarLocation

  • public final class JScrollBarLocation
extends java.lang.Object
    A location in a JScrollBar.
    Author:
    Yvonne Wang, Alex Ruiz

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JScrollBarLocation() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Point blockLocationToScrollDown(javax.swing.JScrollBar scrollBar)
      Returns the location where to move the mouse pointer to scroll one block down (or left.)
      java.awt.Point blockLocationToScrollUp(javax.swing.JScrollBar scrollBar)
      Returns the location where to move the mouse pointer to scroll one block up (or right.)
      java.awt.Point thumbLocation(javax.swing.JScrollBar scrollBar, int position)
      Returns the location where to move the mouse pointer to scroll to the given position.
      java.awt.Point unitLocationToScrollDown(javax.swing.JScrollBar scrollBar)
      Returns the location where to move the mouse pointer to scroll one unit down (or left.)
      java.awt.Point unitLocationToScrollUp(javax.swing.JScrollBar scrollBar)
      Returns the location where to move the mouse pointer to scroll one unit up (or right.)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • thumbLocation

        @RunsInCurrentThread
@Nonnull
public java.awt.Point thumbLocation(@Nonnull
                                                       javax.swing.JScrollBar scrollBar,
                                                       int position)

        Returns the location where to move the mouse pointer to scroll to the given position.

        Note: This method is accessed in the current executing thread. Such thread may or may not be the event dispatch thread (EDT.) Client code must call this method from the EDT.

        Parameters:
        scrollBar - the target JScrollBar.
        position - the position to scroll to.
        Returns:
        the location where to move the mouse pointer to scroll to the given position.
